meanings.definition: A white, tasteless, odorless carbohydrate found in the seeds, fruits, tubers, roots, and stem pith of plants, and used as a thickening agent and in making adhesives and inks.
meanings.sent1: The chef used starch to thicken the soup.
meanings.sent2: She added a spoonful of starch to the sauce to make it thicker.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the starch for snow and tried to build a tiny snowman.
meanings.sent4: The starch in the recipe acted like a glue, holding all the ingredients together perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The starch looked like tiny crystals under the microscope, fascinating the students.

meanings.sent1: Mom starched my shirt for the school play.
meanings.sent2: She always starches her curtains to keep them crisp.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape was so starched, it could stand on its own!
meanings.sent4: His resolve was starched with determination, unwavering in the face of challenges.
meanings.sent5: The old book's pages were so starched, they crackled when turned.
